review_title: Really wonderful mental health agency; systemic problems persist
pros: Great benefits, great supervisor team, working on real structural changes as an agency
cons: some internal systems processes are unnecessarily bloated or unclear; I think that is a caveat of working with any NGO but it can certainly feel frustrating when the leadership's hands are tied.

pros: I really did feel like I was actually contributing something to my local community by serving those who were struggling with mental illness, and it took no time at all to build great professional relationships with my coworkers.
cons: Pay for my position was very low

review_title: Tough but rewarding. Not run well.
pros: Love the patient population. Hard work though
cons: Middle management/leadership doesn't know what it's doing

job_title: Psychiatric Nurse Practitioner in Bremerton, WA
pros: Working with the most vulnerable of society.
cons: Change in management lowered standard of care of patients.

job_title: Licensed Mental Health Counselor Supervisor in Bremerton, WA
pros: Good benefits great colleagues and culture
cons: Terrible management no vision or goals

pros: Worked with some great coworkers. My department had a great leader
cons: Lack of nursing staff. No DON and both nursing supervisors quit when I was working there. Company lacks adequate diversity and inclusion knowledge.

review_title: Okay place to work, no complaints!
job_title: Behavioral Health Technician in Bremerton, WA
pros: I like the people that I work with.
cons: Pay could be better, needs a more consistent scaling system, a lot of changes always occurring, 24/7 units can be difficult to work for

job_title: Behavioral Health Technician in Bremerton, WA
pros:
- Amazing co-workers 
- Somewhat decent pay 
- Great for first starting in the field
cons:
- Lacking upper management 
- Inadequate sick/paid leave system
- Understaffed & high turnover rates
- Expected to do more than your role

review_title: Typical community mental health organization unfortunately.
pros: Always options to transfer internally to new positions since there is a wide variety of mental health services. Good company to explore the mental health field.
cons: Lots of burnt out staff and recommendations from mgmt for more self-care. Toxic positivity is the standard. PTO and Sick Leave is insufficient. CEO/Upper management is disconnected from day-to-day operations and the reality of staff. Excessive client caseloads and focus on productivity & numbers. High turnover with staff. Poor flexibility for staff with medical needs. Large organization that is SLOW to change. Out of touch with current and trending mental health practices. Expensive and underwhelming health insurance options.

pros: There is a lot of training opportunities
cons: You will be over worked and underpaid

review_title: Great staff, but pay could be better
pros: At KMH, the sense of teamwork and comradery is among the strongest of all employers I've had. Everyone involved shares a common goal, and that is to serve the clients.
cons: The compensation and benefits varies WIDLY from position to position.

job_title: Mental Health Care Coordinator in Bremerton, WA
pros:
- The agency is adaptable, is willing to change, and is willing to try new things
- Flexible and predictable work schedule for outpatient clinicians
- Offers many different programs for clients' needs (ex. inpatient, residential services, substance use treatment, services for children and families)
cons: - Change can take a very long time to occur, to the point where the company loses effective employees while waiting to make changes, which leads to high turnover, which then leads to ineffective client care

job_title: Behavioral Health Technician in Bremerton, WA
pros:
Great coworkers with diverse backgrounds 
Client contact forces you to grow as a person
cons:
Stressful & at times unpredictable work environment 
High turn over rate 
Supervisors burn out

pros: Great campus, newly remodeled. Lots of clinical expansion happening. Strong evidence based treatment in use. Excellent team mates! Mission driven. Pay is best in the region (I checked/compared thoroughly). Excellent flexibility during COVID.
cons: Main campus is in East Bremerton (up and coming area, some day). Challenging clients.

review_title: High turnover a sign of the times
pros: Good PTO. high turnover means you can pad your resume with advancement if you are willing to play internal politics for advancement
cons: Poor management, lackluster pay, internal strife, headhunting from bigger competitors means losing our best staff

review_title: Great coworkers and benefits/not so great patient care or pay
pros: Great teammates/benefits, ability to work different positions
cons: CEO/Outlook for company, low pay, patient care was lackluster, understaffed and under-funded

job_title: Department Assistant Floater in Bremerton, WA
pros: Great coworkers, dedicated staff, and a it's a job
cons: Can lead to a lot of burnout dealing with the same clients day after day

job_title: Behavioral Health Technician in Bremerton, WA
pros: Lots of room for growth within the company
cons: The organization is very top-down and middle management doesn't have much power. Organizational decisions are made by people who do not see what happens day-to-day.

pros: Good benefits package, good hours, and great coworkers.
cons: Management was a hit or miss. It was hard to keep upper management.

job_title: Mental Health Professional in Bremerton, WA
pros: Decent place to work. Good people. Health insurance is good.
cons: Benefits really suck. 19 days of PTO (includes sick AND vacation). If you work 12 hour shifts, it’s even less (pro-rated).

job_title: Human Resources Assistant in Bremerton, WA
pros: Great work culture and awesome mission!
cons: None to report at this time

review_title: Decent company to work for, good benefits, very hard job
pros: building own schedule, supportive supervisors
cons: disorganization, changing responsibilities, change in work flow frequently

pros: It was a delight working at the South Kitsap (Port Orchard) satellite office.  The staff working on the front lines with people in need are great.  It's the leadership, removed from reality that is the problem.
cons: Then I was stricken with a disabling condition.  While KMHS touts amazing benefits, they refused to come through on Short Term Disability, using their insurance company (SunLife) as a scapegoat.  Ignoring the professional diagnosis of more than 10 professional medical providers, KMHS refused to pay me the Short Term Disability they had promised me.  I had to fight them tooth and nail for nearly a year just to get a few thousand dollars which they should have provided in my time of need.

review_title: Nice job if you just want to collect a paycheck and are not achievement oriented.
pros: Good medical and dental benefits with low premium.  Excellent PTO.  Most people are great to work with, friendly, approachable. Management is flexible with scheduling and work/life balance.  It's a very humane place to work, for the most part.
cons: Pay is below market.  There is little or no career path, and managers do not encourage career growth.  There is no tangible reward for performance.  It's a stagnant environment.  Awards are given to mediocre or even inept employees, I believe to "encourage" them. Experience and expertise are not valued, but are seen as threatening to some managers.

review_title: What was once great fell into disarray
pros: Not sure anymore. I haven't worked for the organization in a while. I see that the human resources director has left which I can only imagine is something that the organization has going for it. It is a great organization to gain experience; however, it is not a place where you want to stay for a career, at least not anymore.
cons: Sadly, a lot. It is not the organization it once was. When I was first hired it was an amazing organization to work for. Somewhere they lost their way.

job_title: Mental Health Counselor in Bremerton, WA
pros: Easy staff to work with and the job is rewarding.  I would have stayed longer if I was able to get a full time position. It is a great opportunity to meet new people and gain life experience.
cons: The con here is the pay scale. It is somewhat difficult to work your way up and get a full time job because there is a lot of staff that has been there awhile. They promote off of seniority and not performance.

review_title: Formerly great workplace now dysfunctional and negative
pros: There are a lot of wonderful people working here, many who have a wealth of knowledge and expertise and who truly care about the clients and each others.  Team members really work together and help each other.  The agency still tries to do nice things for their employees even though they've had to drastically cut back due to financial problems.  There used to be a lot of other "pros", but in the past couple of years, the corporate culture has done a 180 and those pros no longer exist.
cons: The company culture has become secretive and controlling and has implemented a rigid top-down management style.    Major decisions are made in a vacuum without seeking the advice of other departments and people lower on the food chain who need to be consulted.  Silos exist which prohibit staff members from communicating or coordinating with each other.  All such communication and coordination must go through the top management level of each silo.  Services are often provided in a manner that is not reimbursable to the agency.   Due to financial mismanagement (continuing to expand without the revenue or funding to do so), KMHS found itself $4+ million dollars in the red.  This resulted in austerity measures, including layoffs of many valuable employees.  These layoffs were handled very poorly, with a great deal of secrecy.  The layoff was a surprise attack on June 15th.  Staff were whisked away from their offices and informed that they were being laid off, and were not even allowed to return to their desks to collect the personal property until after hours, as if they had been fired for cause.  Other austerity measures include major cuts to benefits, including a 500% increase in the monthly premium charged to staff for health insurance.  This will be a big impact on paychecks.

pros:
I have worked at KMHS for over 10 years. I have been given the opportunity to progress in my education and career at KMHS. I started off as on-call psychiatric aide at the Adult Inpatient Unit while getting my BA degree, became full time, got promoted to team lead, got promoted to shift supervisor, got my MA degree in counseling, became the clinical supervisor, and am now a manager of one of their other programs. The company, especially the 24/7 department, have been so supportive throughout my journey and I have been so thankful for the mentor-ship and guidance I have been provided.

Working in inpatient and crisis can be extremely difficult and stressful; as well as beautiful and rewarding. I have never had a job that was such a roller coaster before. If you enjoy a fast-paced, constantly changing environment that takes a lot of heart and compassion; working in the the 24/7 department is an amazing experience.

KMHS as a whole had a set back several years ago which hurt it's reputation a lot; it was a difficult time for all of us and even I was feeling like I should leave. I am so happy that I stuck it out. I feel that KMHS has bounced back from that and has become an even better and more innovative agency with more opportunities then ever. They have integrated substance use treatment programs, physical health care, there is a dentist office on sight for clients, we now have a voluntary crisis unit, and many more projects in the works. My department especially, has created a culture of "no job is too small for anybody" (you will see the director doing dishes, the program managers being engaged and on the floor with clients and floor staff). I am very pleased with my career at KMHS.
cons: hard work, can be physically and mentally demanding and can lead to burn out if not responsible for own self care. KMHS struggles with the same things that all community mental health organizations do: not enough funding for what we need, limited resources, and professional shortages.

pros: Most jobs are Monday through Friday. Location is close to places to go for lunch.  Working hours are good, usually 8 - 5pm or 7:30-4:30pm unless you work on the 24/7 units.
cons: Too many changes. Upper management has too many demands.  Most staff complains when you make tiny micro errors. They seem to demand perfection but are not perfect themselves. Too much pressure to remember the daily changes. Too much work to do. Unrealistic demands. You get "in trouble" very easily at this agency.

pros:
Highly supportive work environment
Visionary leadership resulting in the agency providing cutting edge services 
Outstanding benefits and very competitive salaries
Internal promotions are the norm
Agency arranges for on site yoga, massages, and even has a Care & Laughter Committee
cons:
Caseloads very high due to extremely high demand for services
Currently space is limited as new programs and services are implemented without adequate office space
Parking space is nearly non existent

review_title: If you need a job in a pinch, go for it.
pros: A job that pays a smidge more than what is out there. 401k, medical/dental/vision. Has a care & laughter team that tries to get employees involved, yoga classes, massages (just to clarify, you pay for).
cons: There is no set standards, you have each group/team that works independently. Schedule for this group, don't schedule for that group, don't look up appts for this other group. It is very unorganized. In the department that I am, it seems there are a lot of complainers. No one is ever content. This is the most unorganized place of employment that I have worked for.

pros:
Wide variety of clinical services and programs. 
Ability to grow within the company, there are always new programs or opportunities on the horizon. There is a lot of internal promotion and staff development. 
Supervisors and direct care staff are great.
cons: When there are cons they have always been at least looked at by my leadership team, even when the solutions aren't easy to come by.

review_title: Turnover is high pay is low, most employees work off clock to meet demands.
job_title: Child, Family Outreach Therapist in Poulsbo, WA
pros: Co-workers are awesome and dedicated to helping their clients! Hours are sometimes flexible. There are so many clients on your caseload you can offer hope.
cons: Lack of appreciation, no yearly pay raises. Agency does not look stem to staff needs or what is best for the client.

review_title: I don't think I would want a job here
job_title: Mental Health Counselor in Silverdale, WA
pros: I love working with the clients that come in for help! The company used to really care about their employees but that has changed in the last 6 months.
cons: You are overworked, underpaid, underappreciated, given orders and never asked.

review_title: Working there came with both reluctance and reward. It was when clients showed their gratitude that made it worth it.
job_title: Food Preparation Specialist in Bremerton, WA
pros: Caring for those who are in desperate need of help. Benefits are also offered.
cons: Clients can be vulgar and rude, but this comes with the territory

pros: Generous amount of sick / personal leave.
cons: Low pay, very unprofessional workplace.  Stanford Prison Experiment comes to mind often, as middle management and line staff are under-supervised. Turn over is off the charts partly due to bullying  and a very hostile environment.

job_title: Clinical Case Manager in Bremerton, WA
pros: Co-workers and team environment were very strong.
cons: Feels like upper management aren't paying attention to the needs of the front line staff.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Port Orchard, WA
pros: Wonderful boss, great working environment, work you can be proud of, great schedule, flexible, casual attire
cons: Pau slightly below industry standard but great for getting your foot in the door.

pros: Location, flexible schedule, great clients.
cons: Low pay, no clinical supervision, high turnover.

pros: Great coworkers and supportive staff members
cons: Low pay, no raises, management seems immune to concerns of staff and safety

pros: Great teams, supportive Supervisors, good benefits.  Too bad budget it tight.
cons: Benefits just caught up with reality.

job_title: Psychiatric Technician Supervisor in Bremerton, WA
pros:
-good health insurance
-good foot in the door for mental health
cons:
-very poor management
-frequent turnover on inpatient units
-run down facilities

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Bremerton, WA
pros: Co-workers make a great team and make the job feel easier.
cons: Pay rates are lower than market value. Upper management is not available.

pros: Supportive, inclusive, client centric, great staff,
cons: Work is hard but rewarding

pros: Clients are interesting.  Days are busy and go fast.
cons: If you want to have a conversation with a sane person, talk to a client.

pros: It's location. Most employees are committed to the mission
cons: Huge turnover related to negative work culture resulting from poor decisions made by senior leadership

pros: Clients are interesting.  Days are busy and go fast.

pros: It's location. Most employees are committed to the mission

review_title: Really wonderful mental health agency; systemic problems persist
pros: Great benefits, great supervisor team, working on real structural changes as an agency
cons: some internal systems processes are unnecessarily bloated or unclear; I think that is a caveat of working with any NGO but it can certainly feel frustrating when the leadership's hands are tied.

pros: I really did feel like I was actually contributing something to my local community by serving those who were struggling with mental illness, and it took no time at all to build great professional relationships with my coworkers.
cons: Pay for my position was very low

review_title: Tough but rewarding. Not run well.
pros: Love the patient population. Hard work though
cons: Middle management/leadership doesn't know what it's doing

job_title: Psychiatric Nurse Practitioner in Bremerton, WA
pros: Working with the most vulnerable of society.
cons: Change in management lowered standard of care of patients.

job_title: Licensed Mental Health Counselor Supervisor in Bremerton, WA
pros: Good benefits great colleagues and culture
cons: Terrible management no vision or goals

pros: Worked with some great coworkers. My department had a great leader
cons: Lack of nursing staff. No DON and both nursing supervisors quit when I was working there. Company lacks adequate diversity and inclusion knowledge.

review_title: Okay place to work, no complaints!
job_title: Behavioral Health Technician in Bremerton, WA
pros: I like the people that I work with.
cons: Pay could be better, needs a more consistent scaling system, a lot of changes always occurring, 24/7 units can be difficult to work for

job_title: Behavioral Health Technician in Bremerton, WA
pros:
- Amazing co-workers 
- Somewhat decent pay 
- Great for first starting in the field
cons:
- Lacking upper management 
- Inadequate sick/paid leave system
- Understaffed & high turnover rates
- Expected to do more than your role

review_title: Typical community mental health organization unfortunately.
pros: Always options to transfer internally to new positions since there is a wide variety of mental health services. Good company to explore the mental health field.
cons: Lots of burnt out staff and recommendations from mgmt for more self-care. Toxic positivity is the standard. PTO and Sick Leave is insufficient. CEO/Upper management is disconnected from day-to-day operations and the reality of staff. Excessive client caseloads and focus on productivity & numbers. High turnover with staff. Poor flexibility for staff with medical needs. Large organization that is SLOW to change. Out of touch with current and trending mental health practices. Expensive and underwhelming health insurance options.

pros: There is a lot of training opportunities
cons: You will be over worked and underpaid

review_title: Great staff, but pay could be better
pros: At KMH, the sense of teamwork and comradery is among the strongest of all employers I've had. Everyone involved shares a common goal, and that is to serve the clients.
cons: The compensation and benefits varies WIDLY from position to position.

job_title: Mental Health Care Coordinator in Bremerton, WA
pros:
- The agency is adaptable, is willing to change, and is willing to try new things
- Flexible and predictable work schedule for outpatient clinicians
- Offers many different programs for clients' needs (ex. inpatient, residential services, substance use treatment, services for children and families)
cons: - Change can take a very long time to occur, to the point where the company loses effective employees while waiting to make changes, which leads to high turnover, which then leads to ineffective client care

job_title: Behavioral Health Technician in Bremerton, WA
pros:
Great coworkers with diverse backgrounds 
Client contact forces you to grow as a person
cons:
Stressful & at times unpredictable work environment 
High turn over rate 
Supervisors burn out

pros: Great campus, newly remodeled. Lots of clinical expansion happening. Strong evidence based treatment in use. Excellent team mates! Mission driven. Pay is best in the region (I checked/compared thoroughly). Excellent flexibility during COVID.
cons: Main campus is in East Bremerton (up and coming area, some day). Challenging clients.

review_title: High turnover a sign of the times
pros: Good PTO. high turnover means you can pad your resume with advancement if you are willing to play internal politics for advancement
cons: Poor management, lackluster pay, internal strife, headhunting from bigger competitors means losing our best staff

review_title: Great coworkers and benefits/not so great patient care or pay
pros: Great teammates/benefits, ability to work different positions
cons: CEO/Outlook for company, low pay, patient care was lackluster, understaffed and under-funded

job_title: Department Assistant Floater in Bremerton, WA
pros: Great coworkers, dedicated staff, and a it's a job
cons: Can lead to a lot of burnout dealing with the same clients day after day

job_title: Behavioral Health Technician in Bremerton, WA
pros: Lots of room for growth within the company
cons: The organization is very top-down and middle management doesn't have much power. Organizational decisions are made by people who do not see what happens day-to-day.

pros: Good benefits package, good hours, and great coworkers.
cons: Management was a hit or miss. It was hard to keep upper management.

job_title: Mental Health Professional in Bremerton, WA
pros: Decent place to work. Good people. Health insurance is good.
cons: Benefits really suck. 19 days of PTO (includes sick AND vacation). If you work 12 hour shifts, it’s even less (pro-rated).

job_title: Human Resources Assistant in Bremerton, WA
pros: Great work culture and awesome mission!
cons: None to report at this time

review_title: Decent company to work for, good benefits, very hard job
pros: building own schedule, supportive supervisors
cons: disorganization, changing responsibilities, change in work flow frequently

pros: It was a delight working at the South Kitsap (Port Orchard) satellite office.  The staff working on the front lines with people in need are great.  It's the leadership, removed from reality that is the problem.
cons: Then I was stricken with a disabling condition.  While KMHS touts amazing benefits, they refused to come through on Short Term Disability, using their insurance company (SunLife) as a scapegoat.  Ignoring the professional diagnosis of more than 10 professional medical providers, KMHS refused to pay me the Short Term Disability they had promised me.  I had to fight them tooth and nail for nearly a year just to get a few thousand dollars which they should have provided in my time of need.

review_title: Nice job if you just want to collect a paycheck and are not achievement oriented.
pros: Good medical and dental benefits with low premium.  Excellent PTO.  Most people are great to work with, friendly, approachable. Management is flexible with scheduling and work/life balance.  It's a very humane place to work, for the most part.
cons: Pay is below market.  There is little or no career path, and managers do not encourage career growth.  There is no tangible reward for performance.  It's a stagnant environment.  Awards are given to mediocre or even inept employees, I believe to "encourage" them. Experience and expertise are not valued, but are seen as threatening to some managers.

review_title: What was once great fell into disarray
pros: Not sure anymore. I haven't worked for the organization in a while. I see that the human resources director has left which I can only imagine is something that the organization has going for it. It is a great organization to gain experience; however, it is not a place where you want to stay for a career, at least not anymore.
cons: Sadly, a lot. It is not the organization it once was. When I was first hired it was an amazing organization to work for. Somewhere they lost their way.

job_title: Mental Health Counselor in Bremerton, WA
pros: Easy staff to work with and the job is rewarding.  I would have stayed longer if I was able to get a full time position. It is a great opportunity to meet new people and gain life experience.
cons: The con here is the pay scale. It is somewhat difficult to work your way up and get a full time job because there is a lot of staff that has been there awhile. They promote off of seniority and not performance.

review_title: Formerly great workplace now dysfunctional and negative
pros: There are a lot of wonderful people working here, many who have a wealth of knowledge and expertise and who truly care about the clients and each others.  Team members really work together and help each other.  The agency still tries to do nice things for their employees even though they've had to drastically cut back due to financial problems.  There used to be a lot of other "pros", but in the past couple of years, the corporate culture has done a 180 and those pros no longer exist.
cons: The company culture has become secretive and controlling and has implemented a rigid top-down management style.    Major decisions are made in a vacuum without seeking the advice of other departments and people lower on the food chain who need to be consulted.  Silos exist which prohibit staff members from communicating or coordinating with each other.  All such communication and coordination must go through the top management level of each silo.  Services are often provided in a manner that is not reimbursable to the agency.   Due to financial mismanagement (continuing to expand without the revenue or funding to do so), KMHS found itself $4+ million dollars in the red.  This resulted in austerity measures, including layoffs of many valuable employees.  These layoffs were handled very poorly, with a great deal of secrecy.  The layoff was a surprise attack on June 15th.  Staff were whisked away from their offices and informed that they were being laid off, and were not even allowed to return to their desks to collect the personal property until after hours, as if they had been fired for cause.  Other austerity measures include major cuts to benefits, including a 500% increase in the monthly premium charged to staff for health insurance.  This will be a big impact on paychecks.

pros:
I have worked at KMHS for over 10 years. I have been given the opportunity to progress in my education and career at KMHS. I started off as on-call psychiatric aide at the Adult Inpatient Unit while getting my BA degree, became full time, got promoted to team lead, got promoted to shift supervisor, got my MA degree in counseling, became the clinical supervisor, and am now a manager of one of their other programs. The company, especially the 24/7 department, have been so supportive throughout my journey and I have been so thankful for the mentor-ship and guidance I have been provided.

Working in inpatient and crisis can be extremely difficult and stressful; as well as beautiful and rewarding. I have never had a job that was such a roller coaster before. If you enjoy a fast-paced, constantly changing environment that takes a lot of heart and compassion; working in the the 24/7 department is an amazing experience.

KMHS as a whole had a set back several years ago which hurt it's reputation a lot; it was a difficult time for all of us and even I was feeling like I should leave. I am so happy that I stuck it out. I feel that KMHS has bounced back from that and has become an even better and more innovative agency with more opportunities then ever. They have integrated substance use treatment programs, physical health care, there is a dentist office on sight for clients, we now have a voluntary crisis unit, and many more projects in the works. My department especially, has created a culture of "no job is too small for anybody" (you will see the director doing dishes, the program managers being engaged and on the floor with clients and floor staff). I am very pleased with my career at KMHS.
cons: hard work, can be physically and mentally demanding and can lead to burn out if not responsible for own self care. KMHS struggles with the same things that all community mental health organizations do: not enough funding for what we need, limited resources, and professional shortages.

pros: Most jobs are Monday through Friday. Location is close to places to go for lunch.  Working hours are good, usually 8 - 5pm or 7:30-4:30pm unless you work on the 24/7 units.
cons: Too many changes. Upper management has too many demands.  Most staff complains when you make tiny micro errors. They seem to demand perfection but are not perfect themselves. Too much pressure to remember the daily changes. Too much work to do. Unrealistic demands. You get "in trouble" very easily at this agency.

pros:
Highly supportive work environment
Visionary leadership resulting in the agency providing cutting edge services 
Outstanding benefits and very competitive salaries
Internal promotions are the norm
Agency arranges for on site yoga, massages, and even has a Care & Laughter Committee
cons:
Caseloads very high due to extremely high demand for services
Currently space is limited as new programs and services are implemented without adequate office space
Parking space is nearly non existent

review_title: If you need a job in a pinch, go for it.
pros: A job that pays a smidge more than what is out there. 401k, medical/dental/vision. Has a care & laughter team that tries to get employees involved, yoga classes, massages (just to clarify, you pay for).
cons: There is no set standards, you have each group/team that works independently. Schedule for this group, don't schedule for that group, don't look up appts for this other group. It is very unorganized. In the department that I am, it seems there are a lot of complainers. No one is ever content. This is the most unorganized place of employment that I have worked for.

pros:
Wide variety of clinical services and programs. 
Ability to grow within the company, there are always new programs or opportunities on the horizon. There is a lot of internal promotion and staff development. 
Supervisors and direct care staff are great.
cons: When there are cons they have always been at least looked at by my leadership team, even when the solutions aren't easy to come by.

review_title: Turnover is high pay is low, most employees work off clock to meet demands.
job_title: Child, Family Outreach Therapist in Poulsbo, WA
pros: Co-workers are awesome and dedicated to helping their clients! Hours are sometimes flexible. There are so many clients on your caseload you can offer hope.
cons: Lack of appreciation, no yearly pay raises. Agency does not look stem to staff needs or what is best for the client.

review_title: I don't think I would want a job here
job_title: Mental Health Counselor in Silverdale, WA
pros: I love working with the clients that come in for help! The company used to really care about their employees but that has changed in the last 6 months.
cons: You are overworked, underpaid, underappreciated, given orders and never asked.

review_title: Working there came with both reluctance and reward. It was when clients showed their gratitude that made it worth it.

cons: Clients can be vulgar and rude, but this comes with the territory

pros: Generous amount of sick / personal leave.

pros: Wonderful boss, great working environment, work you can be proud of, great schedule, flexible, casual attire

pros: Location, flexible schedule, great clients.
cons: Low pay, no clinical supervision, high turnover.
